Class Bowling

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bowling

  • public class Bowling
extends java.lang.Object
    Author - Tyler Wilding Program - Bowling Score Description - Keeps track of the players score while playing 10 pin bowling.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void bowl(java.lang.String pinsOne)
      Accepts one input for the frame, would be used for a strike for example.
      static void bowl(java.lang.String pinsOne, java.lang.String pinsTwo)
      Accepts two inputs for the frame, can be used for normal hits or a spare.
      static void bowl(java.lang.String pinsOne, java.lang.String pinsTwo, java.lang.String pinsThree)
      Accepts three inputs for the frame, used for the final frame, where a bonus throw is possible.
      static boolean checkUserInput(java.lang.String input)
      Check user input to see if it is not a letter or more than 10.

      Processes the frame's input to enter into the datastructures
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method that runs through 10 frame inputs with a scanner.
      static void printScore()
      Print scorecard method, loops through and prints.
      static int runningTotal(int length)
      Computes the runningTotal up to the current frame to be output at that frame.
      static int totalScore()
      Computes the total score from all of the frames.
      static boolean updateScore(int knocked, int previousShot, int throwCounter)
      Update score method that checks if the throw input is valid, and deals with spares and strikes.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method that runs through 10 frame inputs with a scanner.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments not used.

      • bowl

        public static void bowl(java.lang.String pinsOne)
        Accepts one input for the frame, would be used for a strike for example.
        Parameters:
        pinsOne - First throw's details.

      • bowl

        public static void bowl(java.lang.String pinsOne,
                        java.lang.String pinsTwo)
        Accepts two inputs for the frame, can be used for normal hits or a spare.
        Parameters:
        pinsOne - First throw's details
        pinsTwo - Second throw's details

      • bowl

        public static void bowl(java.lang.String pinsOne,
                        java.lang.String pinsTwo,
                        java.lang.String pinsThree)
        Accepts three inputs for the frame, used for the final frame, where a bonus throw is possible.
        Parameters:
        pinsOne - First throw's details
        pinsTwo - Second throw's details
        pinsThree - Third throw's details

      • frame

        public static void frame(java.lang.String pinsOne,
                         java.lang.String pinsTwo,
                         java.lang.String bonusMove)
        Processes the frame's input to enter into the datastructures
        Parameters:
        pinsOne - First throw's details
        pinsTwo - Second throw's details
        bonusMove - Bonus throw's details

      • totalScore

        public static int totalScore()
        Computes the total score from all of the frames.
        Returns:
        The total score as of so far.

      • runningTotal

        public static int runningTotal(int length)
        Computes the runningTotal up to the current frame to be output at that frame.
        Parameters:
        length - How many frames to add up.
        Returns:
        Total up to that frame

      • updateScore

        public static boolean updateScore(int knocked,
                                  int previousShot,
                                  int throwCounter)
        Update score method that checks if the throw input is valid, and deals with spares and strikes.
        Parameters:
        knocked - The amount of pins knocked down.
        previousShot - The amount of pins knocked down in the previous shot.
        throwCounter - What throw out of 21 is it.
        Returns:
        Will return -1 if error.

      • printScore

        public static void printScore()
        Print scorecard method, loops through and prints.

      • checkUserInput

        public static boolean checkUserInput(java.lang.String input)
        Check user input to see if it is not a letter or more than 10.
        Parameters:
        input - Users input as a string.
        Returns:
        True or False
